instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> pulsing
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> single pulsing only
3V3S5  Stable

VCORE also just comes 0.080v and goes
checked <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> /<CHIP>U1930</CHIP> /<TRANSISTOR>Q8150</TRANSISTOR>
SPI CS L also just spikes
when I remove  <RESISTOR>R8185</RESISTOR> or <RESISTOR>R8111</RESISTOR> either  DDRS3 or  PP1V05 S0 Not present but other voltages remains stable (no vcore)
what may be the issue

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> pulsing
threads.message:
Resolder mentioned resistors.
Then remove <RESISTOR>R8164</RESISTOR>/68 (one by one) and check L7430/60 voltages.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> pulsing
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 99451, member: 682"]
Resolder mentioned resistors.
Then remove <RESISTOR>R8164</RESISTOR>/68 (one by one) and check L7430/60 voltages.
[/QUOTE]


removed <RESISTOR>R8164</RESISTOR>/68 one by one and checked voltages also both resistors removed and checked
but same issue single pulse

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> pulsing
threads.message:
Remove <TRANSISTOR>Q8150</TRANSISTOR> and check again.
Inspect <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> for corrosion.

Did you test in SMC bypass mode?
